title: Correlation vs Causation Quiz
subtitle: Can you tell the difference?
correlationExplanation: A correlation describes only a statistical relationship between two variables, while causality describes a fundamental relationship - a true cause-and-effect connection exists.
correlationExample: Ice cream sales and drowning cases both increase in summer - but ice cream doesn't cause drowning!
causalityExample: Smoking causes lung cancer - there's a direct biological mechanism connecting cause and effect.
note: Note: Your confidence must be 50-100% since you're choosing one answer. If you were less than 50% confident, you'd choose the other option!
trueStatement: This is TRUE - there IS a causal relationship
falseStatement: This is FALSE - it's only correlation
